alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Franklin County through 315 PM CDT... At 231 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Bay, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Red Bay, Vina, Hodges, Pleasant Site, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Atwood, Dempsey, Little Bear Creek Reservoir and Halltown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
